title.narrative: Improve access to emergency primary health care and nutrition services in under served areas

description.narrative:
This is multi-sector project that include health and nutriton elements. 1- HEALTH: WHO is the lead agency for Health Cluster in the country and the agency of last resort aims to enable national, provincial authorities and local communities to more effectively address all public health emergencies through improving the emergency management capacity at all stages of an emergency management cycle preparedness and prevention, alert, response, transition and recovery. This project contributes towards decrease morbidity and mortality among people affected by conflict and Natural disasters by providing emergency primary health care (PHC) services to the target population in right amounts at right time. The beneficiaries will include all those patients will come to health facilities including IDPs, and host communities. WHO will specifically target communities in hard to reach districts where access to primary health care is limited either by conflict or addtional case load of internally displaced population. addtionally the targetted areas have on going circulation of wild polio virus due low coverage of immunization services. This project will specifically focus on providing prmary health care including OPD services, mental health, GBV, growth moniotiring, emergency first aid, and RMNHC services.
Targeted Population: 1. Population in conflict affected areas 2. Populations in underserved areas(conflict affected and remote areas) 3. IDPs 4. Host communities affected by high number of IDPs
Loctions: - Helmand (Nawzad, Musa Qala and Sangin districts) - Kandahar (Shawalikot and Ghorak districts)
The project is in line with HRP/HNO 2020
2. NUTRITION Continuous monitoring by the Public Nutrition Department of MOPH with support from UNICEF and WHO has revealed that Therapeutic Feeding Units TFU's that provide treatment for complicated severe acute malnutrition (SAM) existing were in a sub optimal state and required urgent functional upgrading to improve quality of services provided. The overall project will therefore involve the rehabilitation of 15-targeted TFUs’ in 9 priority provinces. The intervention will strengthen operational and staff’s functional capacity in the 15 (TFUs) that provide treatment and care for children with complicated Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM). Health workers in the targeted TFU's will receive training on inpatient management of SAM, breastfeeding as well as on water, sanitation and hygiene aspects. The targeted TFU’s will undergo assessment followed by functional upgrading, through the provision/replacement of F-75/F-100 milk preparation kits, which are essential in the management of the malnourished children. Equipment including milk preparation kits, cold chain, warming system, bed side chairs for caregivers will contribute to ensuring the quality and efficient continuity of services provided by the TFUs. The activities will therefore contribute towards quality treatment of Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM cases), a life threatening condition requiring urgent treatment and therefore contribute towards decreasing the under-five case-fatality rate. The nutrition activities will complement the improving health service provision in 9 provinces
Areas/provinces and IPs for Nutrition: The catchment population will therefore be the 9 provinces (15 IPD-SAM services) namely Province ( IP ) Health facility Faryab (SDO) : Kohistan, Ghormach and Qaysar ( cover by Maimana, Andkhoy and Sherin tagab TFUs) Maidan Wardak ( SCA): Chak, Jaghato, Nerkh and Saidabad ( cover by Maidanshar, Markaz-i- Behsood, Chak, and Saidabad ) Kapisa( SM/MOPH): Tagab DH Laghman( Health net) : Alishing DH Nuristan ( AHEAD):Kamdesh Paktika (OHPM): Barmal cover by Urgon DH Samangan (AHEAD): Dara-e-Suf-e-Payin DH Badghis (MMRCA): Jawand ( cover by Qala-i- Naw and Murghab TFU) Zabul (SDOampMOPH): Daychopan (cover by Qalat TFU)
